English for Academic Purposes 1

English for Academic Purposes for IHM and FE aims to build on students’ existing English competencies and refine these towards discipline-specific academic contexts. In taking this course, students will have a greater understanding of the conventions and formalities present in academic English alongside developing their ability to create texts and language deemed appropriate for academic purposes. Students will also explore fundamental notions surrounding research such as selecting appropriate sources, identifying stance and perspective, which will better prepare them for their future academic endeavours.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Demonstrate awareness of academic conventions in writing and speaking.

+  Build strategies for working through discipline-specific academic sources.

+  Apply correct referencing systems in their work aligned with the school’s conventions.

+  Demonstrate critical thinking skills in academic contexts.

+  Demonstrate basic research skills suitable for tertiary study.
